question:
The central bank of India or Reserve Bank of India was created before Independence, in the year 1934. The recommendation to create a central bank was made by a commission called:

SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (1st Shift)
option_1: Dr. Raja Chelliah Committee
solution:
The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) was established in 1934 under the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934, and started functioning on April 1, 1935.

The recommendation for establishing a central bank in India was made by the Hilton Young Commission, also known as the Royal Commission on Indian Currency and Finance.

This commission was set up in 1926, and its purpose was to review India’s currency and financial system and recommend the creation of a central banking institution to manage monetary policy, currency, and banking structure.

Additional Facts:

The RBI was initially set up as a private shareholder bank

It was nationalised in 1949, two years after India’s independence

The RBI issues currency (except ₹1 note/coin), regulates monetary policy, and acts as the banker’s bank

The headquarters of RBI was originally in Kolkata and later moved to Mumbai in 1937

question:
Which committee recommended Constitutional recognition for the local government bodies in 1989?

SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
The P.K. Thungon Committee, constituted in 1988, submitted its recommendations in 1989, and was the first to suggest that local bodies should be given constitutional status.

The committee emphasized the need for:

Regular elections to local bodies

Clear devolution of powers and responsibilities

Financial autonomy of Panchayati Raj Institutions (PRIs)

Its recommendations laid the foundation for the 73rd and 74th Constitutional Amendments, which gave constitutional status to Panchayats and Municipalities.

question:
Which of the following commissions/committees identified the existence of legal provisions for implementation of some of the Fundamental Duties?

SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
solution:
The Justice Verma Committee, formed in 1999, studied the status and implementation of Fundamental Duties listed under Article 51A of the Indian Constitution.

The committee identified that many Fundamental Duties are already enforceable through existing legal provisions, even though they are not justiciable on their own.

It emphasized that citizens must be made aware of these duties and the government should take measures to integrate them into education and governance.

Additional Facts:

The Verma Committee recommended that educational institutions should actively promote awareness of Fundamental Duties.

It pointed out that laws related to environment protection, respect for the Constitution, and national symbols align with Article 51A.

The Committee’s findings supported the inclusion of civic responsibilities in national policies.

question:
Which of the following committees had recommended the inclusion of a chapter on the Fundamental Duties in the Constitution of India and stressed that the citizens should become conscious that, in addition to the enjoyment of rights, they also have certain duties to perform ?

SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (4th shift)
option_4: Balwant Rai Mehta Committee (1976)
solution:
The Swaran Singh Committee (1976) was formed during the Emergency by the Indira Gandhi government.

It recommended the addition of a chapter on Fundamental Duties in the Constitution.

The committee emphasized that citizens, while enjoying rights, must also be aware of their duties toward the nation.

As a result, Part IV-A (Article 51A) was added by the 42nd Constitutional Amendment Act, 1976.

Additional Facts:

The committee recommended the inclusion of 10 Fundamental Duties.

These duties were influenced by the Soviet Constitution.

The 11th Fundamental Duty was added later by the 86th Amendment Act, 2002.

question:
Which of the following committees was associated with Industrial Licensing Policy Inquiry?

SSC CHSL 08/07/2024 (4th shift)
solution:
The Dutt Committee was formed in 1969 to review and examine the Industrial Licensing Policy in India.

It was officially known as the Industrial Licensing Policy Inquiry Committee.

The committee highlighted how industrial licenses were being misused, leading to monopoly and concentration of economic power.

Its recommendations played a key role in the formulation of the Monopolies and Restrictive Trade Practices Act (MRTP Act), 1969.

question:
In November 2022, the Supreme Court upheld the 10% reservation of EWS quota. This EWS reservation was granted on the basis of recommendations from which of the following commissions ?

SSC CHSL 09/07/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
The Sinho Commission, officially known as the Commission for Economically Backward Classes, was set up in 2005 under the chairmanship of Major General (Retd.) S.R. Sinho.

The commission was formed to identify and recommend welfare measures for the economically weaker sections (EWS) among the upper castes who were not covered under any form of reservation.

Based on its recommendations, the 103rd Constitutional Amendment Act, 2019 was passed, providing 10% reservation in education and government jobs for EWS in the general category.

The Supreme Court upheld this reservation in November 2022, declaring it constitutional.

Additional Facts:

EWS quota is applicable only to the general category excluding SC, ST, and OBC.

Annual family income limit for EWS is ₹8 lakh or below.

question:
Which of the following persons was appointed Chairman of the Second National Judicial Pay Commission?

SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
The Second National Judicial Pay Commission (SNJPC) was set up in November 2017 by the Supreme Court of India.

Its purpose was to review and recommend the pay structure, allowances, pension, and service conditions of judicial officers in the subordinate judiciary (i.e., judges working under the High Courts across India).

Justice P. V. Reddi, a former Supreme Court judge, was appointed as the Chairman of this Commission.

The commission also aimed to ensure uniformity, dignity, and financial security for the judiciary at the grassroots level.

This was a follow-up to the First National Judicial Pay Commission, which was headed by Justice K. Jagannatha Shetty in 1996.

Additional Facts:

The SNJPC submitted its report to the Supreme Court in January 2020.

The report recommended a significant pay hike, increased allowances, and better pension benefits.

It suggested linking judicial salaries with inflation-adjusted indexation.

The implementation is pending in some states but accepted in several High Courts.

question:
Which report is NOT associated with Fundamental Rights?

SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)
option_1: Tej Bahadur Sapru Report
solution:
The Sarkaria Commission Report is not related to Fundamental Rights. It was set up in 1983 to examine the Centre–State relations in India and recommend reforms to strengthen federalism.

On the other hand, the following reports are directly associated with the idea or formulation of Fundamental Rights:

Motilal Nehru Report (1928): First Indian document to propose a bill of rights, including civil liberties and equality before law.

Tej Bahadur Sapru Report (1945): Recommended inclusion of Fundamental Rights and safeguards for minorities.

JB Kripalani Report: Associated with Congress’s internal discussions on civil liberties and rights around the time of independence.

question:
Rangarajan Committee is associated with _______.

SSC MTS 09/05/2023 (Evening)
solution:
The Rangarajan Committee was constituted in 2012 by the Planning Commission of India under the chairmanship of Dr. C. Rangarajan, former Governor of the RBI.

Its main purpose was to review and update the methodology for poverty estimation in India.

It was formed as an alternative approach to the Tendulkar Committee which had been criticized for underestimating poverty.

Additional Facts:

Poverty Line (2011–12):

Urban: ₹47/day per person

Rural: ₹32/day per person

Estimated 5% of India’s population was below the poverty line using this method.

The committee included expenditure on food, education, health, clothing, and rent to define a more realistic poverty line.

question:
Which of the following commissions recommended that “the appointment of Governor should be nonpartisan” ?

SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
solution:
The Sarkaria Commission was set up in 1983 by the Government of India to examine the Centre–State relations in the country.

One of the major issues it dealt with was the appointment of Governors in Indian states.

The commission observed that many appointments were politically motivated, which harmed the federal structure.

Additional Facts:

The Governor’s appointment should be nonpartisan, and the person selected should be eminent, politically neutral, and not too closely connected with the ruling party at the Centre.

question:
Constitution Review Commission chaired by______recommended some initiatives to be taken by the government for successful implementation of Fundamental Duties.

SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Morning)
solution:
The Constitution Review Commission was established by the Government of India in 2000.

It was chaired by Justice M.N. Venkatachaliah, a former Chief Justice of India.

One of its key areas of focus was the effective implementation of Fundamental Duties listed in Article 51A of the Constitution.

The commission proposed that the government should initiate steps to increase public awareness and integrate these duties into education and public discourse.

Additional Facts:

Introduce Fundamental Duties in school and college education

Run awareness drives through media and public campaigns

Encourage voluntary compliance and legal reinforcement where necessary

question:
How many members are there in the Committee on Public Undertakings in India?

Higher Secondary 03/08/2022 (Shift- 4)
solution:
The Committee on Public Undertakings (COPU) is one of the three key financial standing committees in the Indian Parliament.

It comprises a total of 22 members:

15 members elected from the Lok Sabha

7 members elected from the Rajya Sabha

Members are elected annually through proportional representation using the single transferable vote system.

The primary function of COPU is to examine the reports and accounts of public sector undertakings (PSUs) and ensure they operate efficiently and in accordance with sound business principles.

question:
Which Commission recommended 27%reservation for OBC candidates in all levels of government services ?

SSC MTS 07/10/2021 (Morning)
solution:
The Mandal Commission, officially known as the Second Backward Classes Commission, was established in 1979 by the Janata Party government under Prime Minister Morarji Desai.

It was chaired by Bindeshwari Prasad Mandal, a former Chief Minister of Bihar.

The commission’s primary task was to identify socially and educationally backward classes (OBCs) in India and suggest measures for their advancement.

In its 1980 report, the commission recommended 27% reservation for OBCs in all levels of government services, public sector jobs, and educational institutions.

Additional Facts:

Total backward castes identified: Over 11,000

The report was implemented in 1990 by Prime Minister V.P. Singh, triggering both widespread support and opposition.

This led to major protests across India, especially from upper-caste student groups.
